vyra_base.core package¶

Submodules¶

vyra_base.core.entity module¶

class vyra_base.core.entity.VyraEntity(state_entry, news_entry, error_entry, module_config)¶

Bases: object

Base class for all V.Y.R.A. entities. This class initializes the entity with a ROS2 node, state, news, and error feeders. It also provides methods to register remote callables and manage interfaces. It is designed to be extended by specific entities that require additional functionality. .. attribute:: ros2_node

The ROS2 node for the entity.

type:

VyraNode

state_feeder¶

Feeder for state updates.

Type:

StateFeeder

news_feeder¶

Feeder for news updates.

Type:

NewsFeeder

error_feeder¶

Feeder for error updates.

Type:

ErrorFeeder

state_machine¶

State machine for managing entity states.

Type:

StateMachine

register_remote_callables()¶

Registers all remote callables defined in the entity.

add_interface(settings

list[FunctionConfigEntry]): Adds a communication interface to the entity.

trigger_transition(request

Any, response: Any): Triggers a state transition for the entity.

get_capabilities(request

Any, response: Any): Retrieves the capabilities of the entity.

async add_interface(settings)¶

Add an dds communication interface to this module. Interfaces are used to communicate with other modules or external systems. Interface types can be:

  • !vyra-callable: Callable function that can be invoked remotely.

  • !vyra-job: Job that can be executed in the background.

  • !vyra-speaker: Speaker that can publish messages periodically.

Parameters:

settings (dict) – Settings for the module functions.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the built module functions.

Return type:

dict

Return type:

Any

register_remote_callables()¶
register_storage(storage)¶

Register a storage object to the entity.

Parameters:

storage (Storage) – The storage object to register.

Return type:

None

async trigger_transition(request, response)¶

Trigger a state transition for the entity from internal or remote.

Parameters:

transition (str) – The name of the transition to trigger.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the method is not implemented in the subclass.

Return type:

None
